column5: Forwarded from my brother in law in Winnebago, MN  This is awesome.  While fighting a 36" pike, a 54" - 44# pike >>  >> attacked >>  >>> the smaller fish and was brought into the boat...! >>           I Got this from our production manager, a buddy of his went >>  north >>  >> fishing >>  >>> Rainy Lake (actually the river) but we'll drive by that enroute to > >>  >>> Savant Lake again.  .  I should note, the bait fish (in big >>  >> fish's >>  >>> mouth) was over the slot limit at 36".  This would significantly >>  >>> increase the final cost of this years canada trip if I happen to >>  >> catch >>  >>> something like this.  No replica would hit my wall, that fish >>  would >>  >> not >>  >>> be swimming any longer as I'd turn him into wall art. >>  >>> >>  >>>>>>>>> >>  >>> I'm afraid to swim in the water. >>  >>> >>  >>> Here's a couple of pics you might enjoy.  One for the books. This >>  54 >>  >>> inch, >>  >>> 44 lb. Northern Pike was recently >>  >>> caught up at Rainy River.
And he told two friends, then they told two friends and so on and so on... SSauvain, we see those pics atleast once, probably twice a month. HH
Sorry! Didn't realize I had been duped!
There has to be a way to make money with this.
No need to be sorry! your not the first person here and you probably won`t be the last!
